summary: This is an October 4, 2019, internal update from the Public Corruption Unit summarizing significant developments in two investigations: 1) the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators, focusing on an assistant and Ghislaine Maxwell, and detailing victim accounts from the 1990s; and 2) the investigation into Epstein's suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), revealing that guards falsified logs and failed to conduct required checks on the night of his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the investigation who committed suicide on August 10, 2019, while detained at the MCC on sex trafficking charges. The memo details the ongoing investigation into his co-conspirators.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as actively under investigation for recruiting and grooming victims in the 1990s. The memo cites specific victim accounts involving her.

connections.description: Described as Epstein's former girlfriend who is under investigation for recruiting and grooming victims for him, with victims reporting engagements with both of them.
One of Epstein's assistants is implicated in scheduling massages, setting up rooms, photographing victims, and paying victims as part of the conspiracy.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging while detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) pending trial on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Victim Recruitment and Grooming by Maxwell
events.description: Multiple victims were recruited and groomed by Ghislaine Maxwell in the 1990s, some beginning at age 17. Victims were flown interstate for sexualized massages for Epstein, with instances of sexual assault involving Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Presentations by Guards' Counsel
events.description: Counsel for the two MCC guards under investigation for falsifying logs are scheduled to present to prosecutors on behalf of their clients.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide at the MCC on August 10, 2019, while detained on sex trafficking charges.
The investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators is active, with considerable evidence against an unnamed assistant and a focus on Ghislaine Maxwell for recruiting and grooming victims in the 1990s.
Specific victim accounts from the 1990s detail Maxwell's involvement in recruiting minors, arranging interstate travel for sexual purposes, and participating in sexual assaults.
The MCC suicide investigation found that two guards falsified count sheets and failed to conduct any mandated checks on Epstein throughout the night of his death.
Prosecutors are reviewing a large volume of evidence seized from searches of Epstein's Manhattan and US Virgin Islands residences.
